p: Bioactive polyphenol compounds, such as chebulagic acid and punicalagin, are also hydrolyzable tannins, such as geraniin [ 48], which was previously referenced in this review. Both chebulagic acid and punicalagin are simple ellagitannins that can cooccur in Terminalia species, but 1C4-glucopyranose core plus chebuloyl group compounds, such as chebulagic acid, have been found in the Geranium and Euphorbia genera [ 49], while punicalagin is more related to Punica granatum L., the pomegranate, where it was first isolated [ 49, 50].
